notes: Logic/5GL target using Answer Set Programming (clingo).
Probe uses --outf=2 JSON for stable stdout hashing.
Constrained C subset recommended for bidirectional proofs.
Logic/5GL target using Souffl√© Datalog.
Receipt binds emitted relations; semantic checks can be layered by comparing IR-lowered queries to engine outputs.
Widely used non-Rust/Go target: C#/.NET.
Initial contract is identity-only to avoid unintended network restores during probe; strengthen later with deterministic build vectors.
Compiled target: Go.
Probe uses a no-deps module and build flags to reduce nondeterminism (-trimpath, -buildvcs=false, -ldflags=-buildid=).
Haskell target via runghc for quick iteration without building a full dependency-lock pipeline.
Compiled target: Java (javac).
Probe compiles a single class with -g:none and checks byte-identical .class output.
Hosted runtime target: Julia.
Probe disables startup/history to reduce ambient nondeterminism.
Portable Common Lisp baseline target (family-level).
Produces deterministic source artifacts; no Lisp runtime required.
Use lisp_sbcl for SBCL-specific variant.
SBCL-first Common Lisp variant target.
May use SBCL extensions where appropriate.
Requires sbcl contract acceptance.
Hosted runtime target: Lua.
Probe runs a tiny script that writes a deterministic output file.
Constraint/5GL target using MiniZinc.
Probe uses --output-mode json and hashes stdout as the output artifact.
Hosted runtime target for fast iteration (Node.js).
Dependency management (npm/pnpm/yarn) can be added as additional contracts if/when needed.
Hosted runtime target: PHP.
Logic/5GL target using SWI-Prolog as the engine.
Python source emission baseline (no runtime required for emission).
Use python_cpython for CPython-backed sample-input execution.
CPython-backed Python target for sample-input execution.
Requires python_runtime contract acceptance.
Hosted runtime target: R (Rscript).
Useful for ML-adjacent workflows and statistical tooling.
Hosted runtime target: Ruby.
Compiled target: Rust (cargo).
Probe builds a no-deps crate in release mode into a temp target dir and checks byte-identical output.
SMT-LIB v2 / SMT2 source emission baseline (no solver required for emission).
Use smt_z3 for Z3-backed sample execution.
Logic/5GL target using SMT-LIB + Z3 (solver-backed).
WASM chosen for standardization and portable binary-like output.
